intro: Cerefolium siculum, commonly known as the Sicilian cerefolium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Cerefolium siculum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
